intro: Geissois belema, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its velvety, waxy leaves and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows as a low shrub with dense foliage and produces clusters of small, colorful blooms. It prefers bright, indirect light and well-draining soil to thrive. Geissois belema is popular as a houseplant due to its ornamental value and ease of care.
